Reviews.Title: “ok but small room”
Reviews.Author: carves
Reviews.Content: this hotel was clean and modern but very small. This was my first time to HK so i cant compare it to anything. I guess the location made the price what it was as this part of town. Wasnt cheap on short notice but i had just come from Vietnam where this fee would''ve made me a king. but i'd be happy to stay there again if i had to. Close to heaps of things... i particularly liked the Pelican Bay Florida Beachside Bar which is just on the corner of the lane for a good close hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate - Would choose elsewhere for a trip with any duration”
Reviews.Author: Ft_Garry
Reviews.Content: I stayed here once last year for just one night, and submitted a review. I returned to Hong Kong over the holiday season and was booked into this hotel by my employer. I was there for a total of five nights, and the room was adequate. The bed was just long enough for my 5'10" frame. It was uncomfortably hard though, and I prefer a hard bed. I thought the bathroom / shower were the highlight of the space. It was the only roomy part to the room. The shower had lots of hot water and was quite nice. It had a bench, although the shower head was not adjustable so it made it largely unusable. If I had to guess I'd say that the bathroom was recently renovated. The room was pretty clean. You could tell it was not a new room - the carpet was fairly worn and the furnishings showed their use. I was in the middle room of three on the floor, I found it noisy when the people beside were active, and in the hallway. Expected as much for a hotel in Hong Kong though. As per my last trip, I did not find the staff to be very friendly or outgoing, which I have found to be the norm at most Hong Kong hotels. All in all I was comfortable. On a side note. One of my colleagues was also booked in here. He is 6'3", and got into a room where he did not fit the bed and could not adjust as there was a wall on the head side and a wall on the foot side. He also did not have a clean room, and checked himself out in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: papercamera
Reviews.Content: Room is small and basic but had the necessary amenities, is bright (had a large window) and clean. Liked the recently renovated bathroom. Downside would be the hard bed. Takes some getting used to. Great location in TST, didn't have a problem with the hill. Bus to airport express conveniently located at the foot of it. Near to lots of restaurants, bars and shops.

Reviews.Title: “If You are OVER 6 Ft Tall.....BEWARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: EliF57
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, that I'm used to staying in cramped and small living conditions, having travelled throughout South East Asia and being 6 ft. 3 inches, accommodations always seem just a little "Tight" ...BUT, this had to be the ultimate, "I must be in the Land of Lilliputian" moment!! Not only was the "Room" slightly bigger than a closet (And dirty), but the bed was wedged between to walls. IF you are over 6 ft, as in the my case, there is no way you can lie in bed, without reverting to the "Fetal Position". Since I arrived late, after a 12 hour flight, I decided to speak to the reception, first thing in the morning. After a sleepless night, I informed management that this was unacceptable and that I needed to move to another room, EVEN at a slightly higher price. Well, talking to a disinterested and useless "Clerk" , who informed me, that ALL the rooms were set up in this configuration AND that Id better look elsewhere. Well, I was supposed to stay 6 nights, but after 2 hrs. of searching, I transferred elsewhere, for about the same price. Great location, BUT there are MUCH better Hotels in the area, that are cleaner, bigger AND more important, can accommodate us "Bigger People"....

Reviews.Title: “Short stay but excellent service”
Reviews.Author: RAMRK
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for one night. She was traveling to Chennai from HongKong and the flight was early hours of the next day. Though the room was small, there was everything needed. We were woken up exactly when we wanted, the taxi was ready and the bell team helped us in everything. It was smooth sailing.

Reviews.Title: “this is knutsford”
Reviews.Author: travelingmadam
Reviews.Content: actually i stayed at the Knutsford couple of years ago before they went for renovation and such but i just had the opportunity to write down now. well, i stayed there with large group of people. stayed for two nights. booked the double bed. yes the room was small, typical 3* in Hong Kong, everything is small..anyway, bed was so/so. not that comfy. bathroom was clean but again, small. the lighting was not so bright so it was sort of disturbing for me. for my room, it came with bath tub. hot water was fast, thank God, consider i came during winter. floor was a bit slippery and i could hear noises at night. breakfast was hmm okay. not good enough though for my taste. i did not have chance to try other facilities like the pool and bar ( however i did peek a little and it was small). reception was slow. that's the bad thing. not enough chair for us to sit and again, well, 3* right? the porter who got our luggage was not polite. he demand the tip so badly while yelling in Cantonese which made some of my group member frightened. overall, i don't think i will be staying at Knutsford consider the location (i know it is in Kowloon but located at a small alley?!? don't think so) and the staff services. however, small shops and restaurants are nearby if you are the type who likes local sightings. not sure bout the distance to MTR, i think it is quite far.

Reviews.Title: “Been staying in this hotel with friends over 2 weeks, been to like 8 different rooms.”
Reviews.Author: laapsaap
Reviews.Content: Been staying in this hotel with friends over 2 weeks, been to like 8 different rooms. We all stay in our own room, we had single rooms deluxe rooms etc. Location is ok, good for TST. But we find MTR station too far, so been using taxi exclusively. The steep walk up to the hotel was ok at first, but after tired day of walking or partying it was like climbing a mountain. There are a few rooms next to the lobby desk, you can hear them talk from within your room. People who stayed here probably understand what I am talking about. I refused those 2 rooms. Single rooms were way too small, I can touch the toilet from the the bed. Good thing is you can watch tv on sitting on the toilet or even showering. But yes its very small. I am 5ft11 I dont fit in the bed, so I had to curl up a little. The double rooms are abit better tho. Internet.. was crap. I have a very strong IT background, know everything about networking routers and stuff. Their setup is definately wrong, internet was unusable because it drops connection all the time. Not the wifi connection gets dropped that was full reception, but internet on their end. After first few complaints it still didnt get solved, mind u we had 5 laptops together on different floors so its really them. So if you need internet definately dont come here, there is no option to pay for anything better, Friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Xenon
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night in a single room -the price was good. There was a reasonable amount of space in the room despite it being the single and the bathroom was good too. The hotel is quiet and well located. The bed was spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “New Management, Still a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: UsuallyFarFromHome
Reviews.Content: Was the Mingle, now the Acesite Knutsford, so some aspects of the old reviews may not apply. I've stayed here many times on business, both before and after the management change. Yes, the rooms are very small and there is a short steep hill to walk up if you arrive on foot. Neither of these bother me a bit - you may feel differently. The rooms are clean and modern. You can select tracks from their big CD collection to play in your room. Choice of WiFi or broadband in every room - it is a good quality connection at no extra charge. The new management seems to have cut costs - gone are the two helpful Indian gentlemen who would assist and get to know you - replaced by a couple of sleepy security guards who don't seem to know you are there. That was a loss. Otherwise, for the money, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “More like Mingle tack-hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellitos
Reviews.Content: We secured this room last minute on wotif.com and although we were trying to be conservative with our pennies, for $130 HKD/ 1 night we were extremely disappointed and it was definitely not value for money. I cant say I'm highly savvy when it comes to technology but even I could tell that this claim to being Asia's most technically advanced hotel was an absolute JOKE! Our supposedly free room wi-fi kept dropping out and when i called the reception desk i got a lame excuse that the rain had effected the signal - load of baloney! As for an ipod docking station it must be so highly advanced that it was invisible! The room was small, bed was hard, i found myself wanting to spend most of my time in the bathroom--biggest space! In terms of location once you turned a blind eye to the steep hill the hotel is situated on and the foul stench that seems to surround it, yes it was a winner---being within a stones throwaway of the MTR station and the renowned Nathan Road. I think you get the drift--- unless you have no other choice go mingle somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: OutdoorFreak
Reviews.Content: We booked the room last minute online and got a good price; in fact, it was the best price available in Kowloon or HK Island. We had checked out the hotel on a previous visit to HK so were not surprised with what we got. We booked a double room and this was adequate for our needs. The room was modern and the space although tight, has been well thought through to maximise every inch. The room has free internet, movies, games and music which was great. Bed was futon style so quite hard but suited our taste. Room was surprisingly very quiet which was a relief as it's located next to an Irish Pub and transient residential area. Although we did stay early in the week, so who knows if it gets louder on Fri and Sat nights. Great location just across from Knutsford Terrace (prime dining and night spot in Kowloon). Good massage and shopping options within easy walking distance. Nearest MRT stations Tsim Sha Shui and Jordan. About 10 mins walk to Star Ferry. If you're looking for value in Kowloon, this hotel offers it. Having stayed the week before in the Quality Inn Golden Mile, we were far far happier with our stay here when all things were taken into consideration... NOTE: there used to be a swimming pool but this has been closed. Also, the only restaurants in the building now are Japanese...the others have moved across the road to Knutsford Terrace..

Reviews.Title: “So NOT like the website!”
Reviews.Author: Mitch M
Reviews.Content: This place is about as high-tech as The Flintstones! Very disappointing and certainly NOT what the website or brochure (which they are cheeky enough to have on the front desk) promises. The fingerprint door entry looks to have given up working long ago and the replacement card entry was so secure it wouldn't even open the door to my room. (OK, that's REALLY secure but kind of defeats the purpose of having a door...) They eventually had to give me another room because it just wouldn't open. Forget the LCD screens in the shower, unless you're going to be entertained watching a dodgy aluminium patch with silicone holding it in place. As for the iPod dock (or more correctly: “two RCA audio inputs under the desk”) - I'm a television engineer and even I couldn't make sense of it after two days trying. And the hi-tech entertainment system? Well again, if you have a PHD in electronics and way more patience than I have, you may be able to get it working only to be disappointed yet again by the extensive selection of tired old tunes and movies that await you at the end of your quest. The bed. Ah yes, the bed. Basically every bed in the hotel is a single bed or two single beds jammed together to make a double, which gives you a hard ridge right down the center. But that's the least of your worries. If you like FIRM bedding, then this hotel is for you! I was looking for something softer than a couple of bags of cement wrapped in a sheet. If you took a moment to look closely at the ‘funky’ tiles in the shower, you may find as I did that the ‘pattern’ was actually cleverly hiding mould. My towel had a gaping hole in it, the room was tiny as other reviews have said and, well, I think you get the picture. The bargain deal was too good to be true, as they usually are… You get what you pay for. To be fair, it was mostly clean & the free WiFi was there and did work. You may want to use it to find somewhere to stay for your second night in Hong Kong. If everything else hadn’t been booked out for the Bledisloe Cup, I would have bailed after one night. I met another business traveler in the lift who checked in and out in the space of an hour. He was just going to fly home early rather than stay here. The least they could do is update their website to reflect the actuality.

Reviews.Title: “They Jacked up our rate during Typhoon Nuri”
Reviews.Author: jimboson
Reviews.Content: We're in the middle of a typhoon so we had to stay an extra day because all flights were cancelled. Mingle Place jacked up our hotel rate. They doubled it. It's bad enough that we are trapped during the storm. We begged the concierge Karen to help us and she said there's nothing they can do. Needless to say, we won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Not all features available”
Reviews.Author: TrueRaro
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were very curious about the "worlds first techotel" and expected to be blown away. The hotel was hard to find and situated in a back alley which we thought was unusual and upon asking for directions we found out that it was not well known by the local stores and hotels. If you have luggage, get dropped off at the door for sure. Location is convenient, Service is friendly especially the guy at the lift. Room albeit small is clean and comfortable. The frosted glass shower certainly would create problems for friends or colleagues. No finger printing, customized music or TV in the shower so that was a bit dissapointing. I think the room would be fine if it wasn't oversold in the advertising.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good high tech hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ezzagreat
Reviews.Content: i was very excited about this hotel after reading about the high tech rooms. (finger print entry, surround sound systems, some rooms having lcd screen in the shower). I was expecting a small room when I walked in I was shocked at how small it was! but i guess thats hong kong for you. If you were staying with a friend here there is no privacy what so ever when your having a shower as all that separates the bedroom is a clear glass window/wall. The thousends of movies were great after a long day and there was a pool and a cool irish bar downstairs too. I could even listen to any radio station in the world from my tv! Yes after reading the other reviews the hotel is situated on a hill, so if u have luggage get dropped right at the front, the hill is really steep! a/c was lovely as the humidy was unbearable and temp got to 36 degrees! would prob not stay here again as I would want to stay somewhere else for comparison (would like to see if all hong kong hotels has such small rooms) but location was great! Staff very friendly too!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Solo Traveller with a Budget”
Reviews.Author: intrepudtraveller
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveller I despaired at the prices of hotels in HK until I found Mingle Place. At less than half the cost of most places here its simply perfect. The hotel staff were the friendliest I've come across and were so so helpful with every query I had. There's free internet, a pool, and a 10% discount on the 3 restaurants located on the first 2 floors. Its also in a great location - only about 10-15 mins walk from the Harbour area, 2 minutes walk from Nathan Road and endless shopping. The room is small yes but being HK I dont plan on spending much time there, plus everywhere in HK seems to be quite compact!! (Though it might be a squash with 2 people with 2 suitaces.) The bed is massive and really comfy, the bathroom has a great shower and was really clean, Loads of movies free on-demand and free wi-fi made this hotel a great great choice and I would definately come back any time.

Reviews.Title: “very strange little hotel”
Reviews.Author: janefromcairns
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms, 2 people and 1suitcase mad itt impossible to move . with hard beds, no privacy from bathroom - perspex.. great tv and some hi tech stuff but at the end of a hard day shopping all you want to do is collapse and sleep not play with sound system. was good location but very very steep short road to get to hotel - which broke my trolley bag !! . interesting little area with some odd people hanging around !! we had breakfast one day at the hotel on corner Empire more western breakfast but priccy . on web page says has restaurants but when we took lift to them there was nothing but blank walls !! biazare like a scene from being John Malkovivh !! Only recommend if you cant get anywhere else - like us as it was the silly football sevens game or something !!

Reviews.Title: “Small but well equipped”
Reviews.Author: Spin_king
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend in March 2008. The location is very good, a short walk from the shops and restaurants along Nathan Rd and about 5 minutes walk from Tsim Sha Tsui station. I must say we were a little underwhelmed when we checked in - the staff seemed indifferent to our presence, and although the hotel has been renovated recently it is still obvious that it is an older building. The room was very small - we are travelling with two backpacks and with these on the floor, there was nowhere to stand so we basically had to get into the room and lie on the bed. The bathroom is small but adequate, however as a previous reviewer has mentioned, only share a room with a fellow traveller if you are very comfortable together (ie a partner) as the frosted glass between the bed and the shower leaves nothing to the imagination. On the plus side, the entertainment system was good after a long day shopping as there were plenty of movies on demand (and free) on the 42" plasma TV. Airconditioning was controlled through the TV menu too - took a little while to work out how to use everything but once we got the hang of it, it was pretty good. There is a laundromat downstairs which was convenient and a number of cheap eateries around the corner. The flat panel speakers were a little unimpressive too, although I wonder whether I had them set at an incorrect angle or it was a poor DVD - a couple of the movies we tried to watch were unintelligible. The pool area was closed during our stay which was a shame. All in all, despite some shortcomings (room size, frosted glass, closed pool), the room was functional and served its purpose for what we wanted - and what we paid which was about USD$100 per night, quite a good rate considering the location. Would I stay here again? Not if I could afford to spend more on a 'proper' hotel with bigger rooms. But on a tight budget, then yes.

Reviews.Title: “Room too small”
Reviews.Author: martinbuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed in standard room and there is nowhere to store suitcases - in fact no room to store anything. Would not stay there again unless I was on my own and even then unlikely. Room however was clean and location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Electronic Heaven”
Reviews.Author: aussiechickie
Reviews.Content: We had been roving around the hotels in Hong Kong due to a hotel shortage. We could only get one or 2 nights in any place so I am quite well qualified to comment on hotels in HK - between the ones we did stay at and the ones we looked at but couldn't get a room in I must have seen rooms at 10 different hotels. The Mingle is awesome! The rooms are small but keep in mind that rooms in HK are just really small! Don't expect too much in the budget to mid level range when they say "double bed". I've seen single beds that are bigger than the doubles at some hotels. Whats good about the Mingle: * the torrential shower (I may travel like a backpacker but I like my strong hot showers) * very central location and close to shops (mainly wedding stores) and restaurants. Short walk to Tsim Sha Tsui * the price - great value for bduge accomodations * guys will love the electronic everything - all controled through the TV (did I mention the TV in the shower?) * the huge and comfy queen bed * Above all else - the place is super clean! So new and clean, which is even more rare than a cheap hotel room in HK. One thing to watch out for. Only book this place if you are super comfortable with your travel buddy. The place is uber modern and has a frosted glass bathroom. Of course it makes everything fuzzy but if you are taking a shower with someone sitting on the bed (right on the other side of the glass) they can still see quite a lot! I can imagine that guys might check in liking the electronic gagetry but then the voyeur feel to the bathroom situation might be a challenge for some.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: Aileen
Reviews.Content: My Daughter and I stayed at the Mingle for 3 nights. At first it felt a bit weird as the rooms are so small, but when you get used to it and see all the great stuff they have packed into the room it is really well designed. I did not like the corridors and lobby etc as they were so tiny and cramped. Good location, the guys running the show where friendly, I good choice if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice High tech hotel, but staff isn't that high tech”
Reviews.Author: 3mt1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in deluxe. The room was ok, not too big but also not too small. The staff was quite nice and the service center was very helpful and attend our problem, which was quite a few. The location of the hotel was great, it's located near a lot of restaurants, shopping places, and there's a good money changer that offered quite a good price for US$, it's also near an MTR just a walk around the block. The moment we arrived at the mingle and wanted to check-in, we were quite shocked when the staff said that they didn't have our reservation, which we actually re-confirmed 2 times via telephone 2 days before and 1 day before. It was quite a shock for us and they didn't give us introduction about the hotel and it's facilities which is just a small detail but it's quite affecting our judgement for a hotel. It's a nice small high tech hotel, but the staff seems to have less knowledge about the tech in the hotel itself, such as the fingerprint recog which i actually asked after i got into my room and saw the fingerprint recog device near the door (and it's also seem that the device didn't worked cause we still need to swipe our card upon enter). There was also problem with our A.C cause it's making noise in the night which disturb our sleep and in the morning the floor underneath the AC was dripping wet. But the service center fixed that problem right away in the morning for us nicely. I recommend this hotel if you're young people (single, couple, friends), not travelling with families (babies), full amenities of a hotel (internet (wireless signal is poor, but cable's connection is quite decent), movie, small kitchen, lcd screen, bathroom tv, tea making eq, etc) I don't recommend if u want good pool, really good service, comfy bed (it's not too soft). Overall it's good hotel, but a bit overvalued cause they didn't live up to the expectation of their ads, I will take this hotel as my reserve if my primary hotel in HK is full :)

Reviews.Title: “A cozy hotel to stay over!”
Reviews.Author: SingaTraveller
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent - right in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui within 5 mins walk to the MTR station! Design of the hotel is chic - very cool yet elegant design of the facade! Rooms are well-maintained and come with FULL amenities a traveller would expect. Entertainment system is fantastic with so many movies and music titles to choose from. The free broadband internet access is a real bonus. Many hotels in Hong Kong are charging HK$100 per day but it's absolutely free here! Food choice is aplenty here. Four restaurants are housed in the hotel and there are many more restaurants just across the street along the famous Knutsford Terrace. The business centre is well-equipped with PCs, printer and fax machine. A swimming pool is also available for those who want to relax in after a day of work and/or shopping. Overall, this is an excellent choice for anyone visiting Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Good location approached by short, steep road!”
Reviews.Author: brummiechinese
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mingle Place from 26 June for 7 nights. The hotel is situated in Observatory Court which is the road opposite the Stanford Hillview hotel which not all taxi drivers are aware of. This hotel is a boutique style hotel with rooms featuring LCD panel televisions, fingerprint recognition technology for the room doors (mine didn't work and was issued with a door card), air conditioning. Please be aware that the single rooms are very compact, particularly the bed which was just about long enough for me (I'm 5ft 8in)! Bed linen was clean but the blanket thin but heavy given the hot and humid climate. Bath linen changed daily. The bathroom was similarly compact with a walk in shower and very small sink. The room was made up every day although I noticed that the mirror panels in the room were never dusted down. Tea making facilities are provided and there is a small fridge under the token storage space area for hanging your clothes. The room boasts wireless networking, but the signal strength was consistently poor and non-existent and I gave up trying to connect at times although a network cable was provided (results equally poor). Staff were efficient and courteous but did not really go that "extra mile". The area is minutes from the well known Nathan, Carnarvon, Granville Road areas for shopping although Harbour City is also nearby and a favourite (and the local Fitness First gym!) and eating areas. You are also well served with bars and restaurants in the cosmopolitan Knutsford Steps area which is literally 2 mins from the hotel. Tsim Tsa Tsui MTR also close by. Unfortunately, I am unlikely to be returning to this hotel which promised much but failed to deliver overall.

HotelInfo.Name: Acesite Knutsford Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: No.8 Observatory Court, Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong, China
